lines.text: For Heaven's sake, let's be gay about this!
That suite hasn't been opened all this summer, madame. You gave orders to have it closed.
Bosh! I did nothing of the sort. Well, open it.
Don't come back in here with a wet bathing suit. Not that I mind you dripping and more emphasized. But, there's another guest arriving.
Tommy, this is Mrs. Cortland Brown. She's not as sweet as she looks. But, you'll think she is.
How do you do? Oh, you magnificent, long-legged Britishers; I've been avoiding you in Paris. But, you are wonderful, aren't you?
Kitty. Kitty, come here!
She doesn't hear you. She seems to be absorbed in a man.
You know, if I were a man, I should fall in love with her at once.
You've certainly changed.
Ha-ha. I hope so! Three years in Paris ought to improve any woman. Like you, I've been amusing myself with anything and everything that came my way. I know how a man feels about those things now.
Oh, pardon the intrusion. You weren't trying to vamp him, were you Kitty?
And what would it mean to you if I were? Would it be a joke or a tragedy?
Oh, my soul! Who's going to pay my loses?
I shall be delighted. I love to have beautiful women under obligation to me.
Cherrio, Bootsy!
Oh, Kitty, how can you be a party to such an...
Is the word affair? Because if it is, it's mine and nobody elses.
Bob, I'm not going back, I'm going on. I don't know just to what, but on. So, then, let's be gay about it.
I've been so gay, so-so full of - romances.
